home.body_songs: Spotify Song Suggester uses the Spotify API along with Machine Learning techniques to recommend songs that users are likely to enjoy. Below are your top 5 picks based on the evaluation of liked songs displayed in the "Favorite Songs" section. As you you add/remove songs from favorites your homepage will reflect your current musical profile.

sliders.body_key: The estimated overall key of the track.
sliders.body_mode: Mode indicates the modality (major or minor) of a track, the type of scale from which its melodic content is derived.
sliders.body_time_signature: An estimated overall time signature of a track
sliders.body_acousticness: A confidence measure from 0.0 to 1.0 of whether the track is acoustic
sliders.body_danceability: Danceability describes how suitable a track is for dancing based on a combination of musical elements including tempo, rhythm stability, beat strength, and overall regularity.
sliders.body_energy: Energy is a measurement that represents a perceptual measure of intensity and activity. Typically, energetic tracks feel fast, loud, and noisy. For example, death metal has high energy, while a Bach prelude scores low on the scale. Perceptual features contributing to this attribute include dynamic range, perceived loudness, timbre, onset rate, and general entropy.
sliders.body_instrementalness: Predicts whether a track contains no vocals. “Ooh” and “aah” sounds are treated as instrumental in this context. Rap or spoken word tracks are clearly “vocal”.
sliders.body_liveness: Detects the presence of an audience in the recording. Higher liveness values represent an increased probability that the track was performed live
sliders.body_loudness: Loudness values are averaged across the entire track and are useful for comparing relative loudness of tracks. Loudness is the quality of a sound that is the primary psychological correlate of physical strength (amplitude).
sliders.body_speechiness: Speechiness detects the presence of spoken words in a track.
sliders.body_valence: A measurement describing the musical positiveness conveyed by a track. Tracks with high valence sound more positive (e.g. happy, cheerful, euphoric), while tracks with low valence sound more negative (e.g. sad, depressed, angry).
sliders.body_tempo: In musical terminology, tempo is the speed or pace of a given piece and derives directly from the average beat duration.
